alert.note: Alert for Coke; Runnels; Taylor (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 4:54AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHERN COKE...SOUTHERN NOLAN...SOUTHWESTERN TAYLOR AND NORTHWESTERN RUNNELS COUNTIES THROUGH 530 AM CDT... At 454 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Sanco, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Robert Lee, Blackwell, Maverick, Nolan, Bronte, Hylton, Maryneal, Norton, E.V. Spence Reservoir Near Paint Creek Recreation Area, Wingate, Happy Valley, Silver, Fort Chadbourne, Sanco, Shep, Wilmeth, Camp Butman, The Intersection Of Highway 70 And Ranch Road 53, and Oak Creek Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in San Angelo.
